item.description:
纽约市13岁男孩涉嫌杀害18岁女大学生 路透社14日援引当地媒体报道称，美国纽约市警方13日透露，已逮捕一名13岁的男孩，该男孩涉嫌与纽约市一名18岁的女大学生被杀案有关。报道称，这一消息令近年来犯罪率大幅下降的纽约市市民感到不安。
https://himg2.huanqiucdn.cn/attachment2010/2019/1214/14/23/20191214022316128.png
路透社报道截图路透社表示，据纽约市警察局消息，该市巴纳德学院18岁的女大学生泰莎·梅杰斯(Tessa major)11日晚在曼哈顿哈勒姆区的“晨边公园”(Morningside Park)被抢劫者刺中数刀。随后，她挣扎着走出公园，到离附近巴纳德学院不远的保安亭寻求帮助。然而，不幸的是，随后被送去医院救治的梅杰斯被宣布死亡。
针对此案，当地时间13日，纽约市警察局局长罗德尼·哈里森(Rodney Harrison)在推特上表示，目前“1人已被逮捕，且(警方)仍在积极调查中。”嫌疑人究竟是什么样的人？官方并没有透露更多信息。不过，美国哥伦比亚广播公司(CBS)下属CBS2新闻台援引匿名消息称，警方12日搜查案发地附近一座大楼时，发现一名13岁的男孩，他的衣服符合对嫌疑人的描述，且该男孩被发现时随身携带一把刀。
据报道，该男孩已向警方承认，他和两个朋友曾试图抢劫梅杰斯，并刺伤了她。
报道称，很长时间以来，“晨边公园”一直被认为是一个不安全的地方，这里曾有许多犯罪案件发生，包括谋杀案。路透社还表示，近年来，纽约市的犯罪率呈逐步下降趋势，但该市官员承认，今年最后几个月里，该市谋杀案的数量有所上升。

The Barnard Bulletin in 1976 described the relationship between the college and Columbia University as "intricate and ambiguous". Barnard president Debora Spar said in 2012 that "the relationship is admittedly a complicated one, a unique one and one that may take a few sentences to explain to the outside community".
Outside sources often describe Barnard as part of Columbia; The New York Times in 2013, for example, called Barnard "an undergraduate women's college of Columbia University". Its front gates state "Barnard College of Columbia University". Barnard describes itself as "both an independently incorporated educational institution and an official college of Columbia University" that is "one of the University's four colleges, but we're largely autonomous, with our own leadership and purse strings", and advises students to state "Barnard College, Columbia University" or "Barnard College of Columbia University" on résumés. Facebook includes Barnard students and alumnae within the Columbia interest group.
Columbia describes Barnard as an affiliated institution that is a faculty of the university or is "in partnership with" it. Both the college and Columbia evaluate Barnard faculty for tenure, and Barnard graduates receive Columbia University diplomas signed by both the Barnard and the Columbia presidents.
